post.title: Users who choose to have a public profile, why?

author.bio: Fantasy lore enthusiast, Human history critic. Your feelings do not matter. Speak your mind.  Counter bad ideas with good ideas. Pro LGB, Pro Guns, Pro Drugs, Pro Human, Anti Race. FUCK THE CCP!
author.bio_html: Fantasy lore enthusiast, Human history critic. Your feelings do not matter. Speak your mind. Counter bad ideas with good ideas. Pro LGB, Pro Guns, Pro Drugs, Pro Human, Anti Race. FUCK THE CCP!

body:
The truth, I don't want it public because speaking the truth about certain things can have real life consequences Especially if you reiterate anything regarding things like race realism, or statistics that don't fit the woke narrative, 15% commit 56%, or 41% suicide. or the demonetization of patriotism. Kids get suspended for liking the president for fucks sake. Just being conservative can get you fired. 

Its already a risk posting here. I have 2 accounts this one for mild stuff and memes and another where I go hard anti political correctness for memes its under a false email, I use a different IP to ad another layer of separation. 

Acting like the people who run AHS wont jump at the chance to ruin your life is just stupid. They are like rabid dogs.
body_html:
The truth, I don't want it public because speaking the truth about certain things can have real life consequences Especially if you reiterate anything regarding things like race realism, or statistics that don't fit the woke narrative, 15% commit 56%, or 41% suicide. or the demonetization of patriotism. Kids get suspended for liking the president for fucks sake. Just being conservative can get you fired.

Its already a risk posting here. I have 2 accounts this one for mild stuff and memes and another where I go hard anti political correctness for memes its under a false email, I use a different IP to ad another layer of separation.

Acting like the people who run AHS wont jump at the chance to ruin your life is just stupid. They are like rabid dogs.

body:
Why would you enter a false email when you don't need an email to create an account?

(Also, this post was kind of targeted towards those who refuse to make their profiles private, not those who do want to make their profiles private.)
body_html:
Why would you enter a false email when you don't need an email to create an account?

(Also, this post was kind of targeted towards those who refuse to make their profiles private, not those who do want to make their profiles private.)

body: I'm not a pussy ass bitch. If someone wants to challenge what I say, I'll make it as easy as humanely possible for them to do so. If someone wants to dig through my profile and pull out random shit, let them do so. If someone wants to scroll through every post and comment and downvote it, be my guest. As a token of respect to this website and the freedom it represents, I choose to be free and proud of everything I say here. I have nothing to hide.

If someone wants to dig through my profile and pull out random shit, let them do so. If someone wants to scroll through every post and comment and downvote it, be my guest. As a token of respect to this website and the freedom it represents, I choose to be free and proud of everything I say here. I have nothing to hide.

post.body: Just wondering after seeing posts where others stated their [various reasons](https://ruqqus.com/post/xk1/why-do-so-many-users-have) for making their profiles private.
post.body_html: Just wondering after seeing posts where others stated their various reasons for making their profiles private.
post.title: Users who choose to have a public profile, why?

body:
I think public profiles add value to sites like this.  For example, if you find an interesting post it's nice to be able to check the user's comments for more of the same.

Yeah, there's some negative stuff that can come along with a public profile, but I think it's worth the risk to help make the place a little better.
body_html:
I think public profiles add value to sites like this. For example, if you find an interesting post it's nice to be able to check the user's comments for more of the same.

Yeah, there's some negative stuff that can come along with a public profile, but I think it's worth the risk to help make the place a little better.

author.bio: No reason for me to be here anymore. If you’re interested in anime art ping me and maybe I’ll respond.
author.bio_html: No reason for me to be here anymore. If you’re interested in anime art ping me and maybe I’ll respond.

body:
I want those who follow me to have easy access to my what I post and comment. It's nice to see what other people are like and have a sense of community. Also now that you have to individually downvote each post the amount of downvote brigades has gone down.

Unlike other users here I don't do it for some sense of "transparency" in arguments, just for the convenience of those who like what I post.
body_html:
I want those who follow me to have easy access to my what I post and comment. It's nice to see what other people are like and have a sense of community. Also now that you have to individually downvote each post the amount of downvote brigades has gone down.

Unlike other users here I don't do it for some sense of "transparency" in arguments, just for the convenience of those who like what I post.

body: because I cant be bothered to privatise it, and because I dont care if other people can see my post history. I'm not ashamed of what I post. plus, like someone else said; it adds transparency when eg debating someone
body_html: because I cant be bothered to privatise it, and because I dont care if other people can see my post history. I'm not ashamed of what I post. plus, like someone else said; it adds transparency when eg debating someone

guild.description:
Ask and answer questions.

Rules:

🤔 Posts must be questions. This is a community dedicated to Q&A discussion, so post titles must be in the form of a question.

⁉️ No loaded questions.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

🥾 Breaking these rules will result in posts being kicked and possibly an exile.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

post.body: Just wondering after seeing posts where others stated their [various reasons](https://ruqqus.com/post/xk1/why-do-so-many-users-have) for making their profiles private.
post.body_html: Just wondering after seeing posts where others stated their various reasons for making their profiles private.
post.title: Users who choose to have a public profile, why?

body: It's the default and i don't exactly want to change it. Besides i don't think i've said anything dumb enough to worry about here and people would have a pretty hard time working out who i am on reddit/other platforms (except maybe consumeproduct.win where my name is similar though that place is filled with too many fedposters for me to actually want to be active there)
body_html: It's the default and i don't exactly want to change it. Besides i don't think i've said anything dumb enough to worry about here and people would have a pretty hard time working out who i am on reddit/other platforms (except maybe consumeproduct.win where my name is similar though that place is filled with too many fedposters for me to actually want to be active there)

author.bio: Former Hells Angel, ex-carny, briefly a merc, and now retired....but still raising enough hell to get booted from Reddit, and banned from Facebook without ever joining.
author.bio_html: Former Hells Angel, ex-carny, briefly a merc, and now retired....but still raising enough hell to get booted from Reddit, and banned from Facebook without ever joining.

body: Don't know whether mine is public or private, nor do I give a crap. Public or private is a non-issue for me.
body_html: Don't know whether mine is public or private, nor do I give a crap. Public or private is a non-issue for me.

body:
>I want those who follow me to have easy access to my what I post and comment. It's nice to see what other people are like and have a sense of community.

Same for me. I often view others' profiles because I like what they post.
body_html:
I want those who follow me to have easy access to my what I post and comment. It's nice to see what other people are like and have a sense of community.

Same for me. I often view others' profiles because I like what they post.

parent.body:
I want those who follow me to have easy access to my what I post and comment. It's nice to see what other people are like and have a sense of community. Also now that you have to individually downvote each post the amount of downvote brigades has gone down.

Unlike other users here I don't do it for some sense of "transparency" in arguments, just for the convenience of those who like what I post.
parent.body_html:
I want those who follow me to have easy access to my what I post and comment. It's nice to see what other people are like and have a sense of community. Also now that you have to individually downvote each post the amount of downvote brigades has gone down.

Unlike other users here I don't do it for some sense of "transparency" in arguments, just for the convenience of those who like what I post.
